Class EnumerationInferencer

  • java.lang.Object
    • EnumerationInferencer

  • public class EnumerationInferencer
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the depth-first inference by enumeration algorithm for exact inference in Bayesian networks described in AIMA Figure 14.9.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EnumerationInferencer() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected double enumerateAll(java.util.List<RandomVariable> vars, Assignment e, BayesianNetwork bn)
      Recursive (depth-first) step in the enumeration algorithm for answering queries on BayesianNetworks.
      Distribution enumerateAsk(RandomVariable X, Assignment e, BayesianNetwork bn)
      Return the posterior Distribution P(X|e) for RandomVariable X given Assignment e (evidence variables and their values) using the joint probability distribution encoded in the given BayesianNetwork.
      java.util.List<RandomVariable> getVariablesInOrder(RandomVariable X, Assignment e, BayesianNetwork bn)
      Returns the RandomVariables from the given BayesianNetwork in the following order: first the query variable X, then the hidden variables Y, then the evidence variables E.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
      Test driver for EnumerationInferencer: Loads aima-alarm.xml, asks for the distribution P(B|j,m), and prints the result together with the expected result given in the textbook.
      protected void trace(java.lang.String msg) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • EnumerationInferencer

        public EnumerationInferencer()

    • Method Detail

      • enumerateAsk

        public Distribution enumerateAsk(RandomVariable X,
                        Assignment e,
                        BayesianNetwork bn)
        Return the posterior Distribution P(X|e) for RandomVariable X given Assignment e (evidence variables and their values) using the joint probability distribution encoded in the given BayesianNetwork.

      • getVariablesInOrder

        public java.util.List<RandomVariable> getVariablesInOrder(RandomVariable X,
                                                 Assignment e,
                                                 BayesianNetwork bn)
        Returns the RandomVariables from the given BayesianNetwork in the following order: first the query variable X, then the hidden variables Y, then the evidence variables E. This order is crucial to the enumerateAll method, but not really mentioned in the textbook.

      • enumerateAll

        protected double enumerateAll(java.util.List<RandomVariable> vars,
                  Assignment e,
                  BayesianNetwork bn)
        Recursive (depth-first) step in the enumeration algorithm for answering queries on BayesianNetworks.

      • trace

        protected void trace(java.lang.String msg)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
                 throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                        org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Test driver for EnumerationInferencer: Loads aima-alarm.xml, asks for the distribution P(B|j,m), and prints the result together with the expected result given in the textbook.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
        org.xml.sax.SAXException
        java.io.IOException
